features: ★ 【Features】SIHOO ergonomic chair with adjustable headrest can make neck tilt easily and comfortably, adjustable lumbar support bracket for free adjustment of height depth, 3D adjustable armrest for different office applications, 90°-126° arbitrary backrest adjustment for multiple work positions, any switch 3.15 in lift, 360 ° Freedom to rotate freely 3D handrail.

★ 【Ergonomic design】SIHOO ergonomic office chair is recommended by Ergonomics Application Association. SIHOO's ergonomic design is based on the human body dynamic digital model. The ridge backrest and the human spine are exactly the same. The close fitting helps release the spinal pressure. The flow waterfall arc seating design Thigh support is comfortable, SIHOO will make you more comfortable.
★ 【Material】Our home office desk chair aluminum base is stable and durable, bearing quality is good. Silent casters move freely without noise. Double back frame design, stable and durable.

★ 【Design】SIHOO is the crystallization of the common wisdom of many professionals in human body, physiologist, product designer, mechanical engineer，does its best to make every step comfortable and safe for every customer. Every small part has strict safety quality testing. Cushion impact test, handrail fatigue test, chair foot static pressure test, in line with the strict standards of office chair.

★ 【Warranty】Product warranty period is three years. If there is any quality problem, please contact us. After confirming, we will change the accessory for you. We promise to provide you with zero profit product accessories within three years of the warranty period.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Option for a Budget Chair - Love the Adjustability
reviews.reviewText: I've had this chair for a couple weeks now and am pretty happy with it. I was using a hand-me-down gaming chair that was super cheap, falling apart and starting to hurt my back. Instead of getting another gaming chair, which I feel like are mostly for looks and don't really provide any support, I wanted an ergonomic one, but didn't have several hundred dollars to a grand to throw at a really nice brand name chair. This is the only chair I found that fit both my budget and my criteria: all mesh, adjustable lumbar, included adjustable headrest, tilt tension control, and adjustable armrests. For reference, I'm 5'4, 120 lbs, and this chair fits me really comfortably.I like the lumbar on the most shallow setting--it's just enough support without being obtrusive, and I'm really glad you can adjust the height. I love being able to adjust the seat tilt and tension as well, since I'm super active in my chair and like to rock back and forth at my desk and lean back for breaks. I sit at my desk all day for work, and after work I stay there and game, so I needed a chair that would recline and be good for lounging too (also why the headrest was so important).There is hard plastic on the edges of the seat and backrest, but it doesn't really bother me. I like to be an "ergonomic rebel" and sit cross-legged a lot, and I don't find that the edges of the seat hurt my legs. Although I'm on the shorter side, so your mileage may vary if you're taller and like to sit with your legs curled up.The mesh feels firm and has enough give to be comfortable while providing support and breathing. Again, I'm on the smaller side so I don't think the mesh sagging will be too much of an issue for me personally. I actually really like the headrest--it fits in the curve of my neck comfortably, and even though you can't move it forward or back, I feel like being able to tilt up and down and change the height makes up for it.You'll definitely want to take time to play around with the adjustability and find the right fit for you. The only other thing I would have liked is the ability to move the arms in and out horizontally (I like to have the arm rests really close to me, but if you need them to be wider it looks like you can move them farther apart when assembling), but I wasn't expecting to find that in a $200 chair, and I'm just glad I can adjust the arm rests forwards backwards, up, down, and rotate them. I use that functionality a lot, so it works great for my needs. The arm rests themselves are made of a pretty hard rubber but have some slight give, so not just rock-hard plastic. If you need the arm rests to be cushy you can probably get covers for them.Assembly was pretty straightforward, but I followed their video as well just to make sure I did it right. Some of the castors required extra force to attach, but felt solid once they were in. Haven't had any issues with squeaking or creaking yet--still feels pretty sturdy (and I sit in it for 10+ hours a day). I did check all the pieces for scuffs, dents, or tears before assembling, but everything was in good condition. I'd read great reviews about SIHOO's customer support beforehand though so I wasn't worried in the case I did need to replace anything.Overall, if you want a chair that has ergonomic features and adjustability, and doesn't break the bank, I'd recommend this one. I did weeks of research before deciding on it and I'm pretty happy with my decision, especially for the price! In the future when I have a thousand dollars to invest in a Herman Miller or Haworth I'll probably upgrade, but I'm more than happy with this chair in the meantime.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not suitable for Plus size people
reviews.reviewText: Just got this chair today, assembly is very easy and the parts are very robust, most of this chair feels high quality except the plastic paddle on the lever that adjusts the height and locks & unlocks the reclining function and the headrest attaches to the back of the chair. That part is a bit cheap feeling but as long as you don't have someone jokingly pull the chair back by the headrest it shouldn't be a problem, but if some joker wants to pull on it to scare you, it could break eventually. As to the long term comfort, right now I can not attest to that yet. But what I can tell you is that this chair is not meant for very wide people with a very large rear-ends. The chair is narrow, I am a small guy 5'5" 150lbs and this chair is just the right size for me. THE HEADREST at its lowest setting and tilted all the way back is just the right place for it to rest just under the back of my skull and just above me shoulders just they way those U shaped travel neck pillows rest around you neck to give the back of your neck support when you are traveling. So if you are shorter, it wont rest there most likely. That's where I like it to be but you may differ, but what I can tell you is that if you don't rest it there it will force your head forward because it doesn't move back any farther, which I don't like. THE LUMBAR SUPPORT is okay, this chair allows you the screw it in as far as you like and for me its in the right place, but as far as it goes I've never had a chair with this so it takes some getting used to, but you an just unscrew it so you cant feel it, but I want to be in a proper ergo so I will just get used to it. THE ADJUSTABLE HEIGHT is good for me as a short guy many office chairs don't adjust low enough, and even though I can put my feet flat on the ground for most of them, the weight of the backs of my legs are entirely being held by the chairs seat instead of letting me reduce pressure on the back of my legs with my feet allowing my knees to be at an 80 degree angle instead of a hard 90 degree angle putting unneeded pressure on my hamstrings. I am using it while writing this review and it is currently at the lowest setting and it is perfect for me, so if you are shorter then me take that into account. As well be careful with the lever that adjusts the height because it is one of the only things that I can see breaking if you are not mindful. THE BACK REST is very comfortable because for me at least it has a high back and is just broad enough in the shoulders and for a small guy I have broad shoulders. I have a different mesh chair with a short back and the metal frame that holds the mesh on that chair constantly digs into my back and I cant bare sitting in it for very long but it was free so beggars cant be choosers. There is nothing able to do that on this chair for my body size and I appreciate that very much. THE SEAT is fully mesh with a cushion under the knees and seems to be comfortable as of right now, as I said long term comfort is still to be decided. But at first feel, I can say as long as you keep your legs facing forward I don't foresee a problem. But when I decided to buy a fully mesh chair I realized one of my favorite ways to sit will no longer be possible. I like to Spread my legs and have my right leg off the side of the chair instead of the front. With mesh chairs, because of their nature, they are elevated on the sides similar to a bucket seat chair, but there are no cushions so it will surely cut off circulation so this is a no go. This is something I knew going into this purchase and decided it was worth a try and I can just get used to it. Another position I like is to sit in my chair cross legged. This is still possible but not the most comfortable because the bucket shape isn't as comfortable for my feet. The comfort of the seat is probably the most important part of this chair for me. I will be sitting in it every day for very long periods of time and I need something that wont fatigue my butt, tailbone and the back of my legs, if this mesh seat creates pressure points and I begin to get sore, I will try and update this review, and I will probably return the chair and look for a regular cushion chair or buy the regular cushion style of this chair because they make one with a plush cushion as well. Hope this cleared something up for some of you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice Quality and Build (Just know before purchasing)
reviews.reviewText: Like I said this chair is great in comfort and really shines best with a nice set of caster wheels added to give it the high quality feel and smooth rolling. That said, some things I wish I knew before purchasing.Gloves are included with the kit to build the chair and I highly recommend using them. The machine finish on the Allen key was so rough I got metal fragment splinters in my finger and it stung for the next 24 hours at the location when any form of pressure occurred. PUT ON THE GLOVES FIRST BEFORE BUILDING THE CHAIR.The chair does recline back more than enough though the part that I was slightly dissatisfied with was the locking points of this reclining feature. There are only 3. All the way forward halfway back (which I use most) and full back to a resting position which is more ideal for napping or media viewing. THERE ARE ONLY 3 LOCKING POINTS ON THE RECLINER I WISH THERE WAS MORE FOR BETTER ADJUSTABILITY.Finally, I am a 5’11” man that has completely maxed out the tilt and height adjuster for the headrest on this chair. If you are any taller then this do not buy this chair. I only wish I had 1-2 click for the height and it would be a chair perfectly built for my body structure. I also wish the degree or rotation for the tilt would go further back for my noggin to lay it back farther sometimes but it does the just when I’m active at the computer. HEADREST HAS MINIMUM ADJUSTABILITY AND DOESN’T SUPPORT ANYONE 6’ OR TALLER.Final notes:Armrests = good and adjust a little too easy imoLooks = premium and luxuriousInstructions = clear though screw labeling could use workBreathability: like a charm nice and coolFINAL REVIEW4/5 Stars

i really like the design and quality of this chair, it is as described. was easily bale to assemble without any issues. it is perfect for my height 5'9 and i can see it an issues for people taller than 6'2 as the head support will not be sufficient. so far so good after using it for a few months now and it is very sturdy. definitely recommended and will buy again if needed, i got it on a sale price so that was a bonus

Es bastante fácil de armar y de instrucciones claras. Es comoda y no ocupa demasiado espacio. Considero que vale la pena el precio. El material es resistente y sobretodo que la parte del asiento tiene tela transpirable por lo que si pasas mucho tiempo en ella no dañara el producto.

reviews.reviewTitle: ottima per la fascia di prezzo
reviews.reviewText: PRO:- molto comoda- qualità nei materiali- seduta e schienale traspiranti- robusta- molto regolabile- colore grigio (meglio che il solito bianco)- facilità di assemblaggio- estetica minimal/futuristicaCONTRO:- poggiatesta non rimovibile una volta inserito senza dover smontare l'attacco (è più facile di quanto sembra)- supporto lombare regolabile un po' duro se regolato più verso la seduta- inclinazione un po' dura all'inizioCi ho messo circa 15/20 minuti ad assemblarla, gli step erano davvero facili e intuitivi. Dal momento che mi sono seduto fino a 3 ore dopo non ho sentito la differenza, confortevole come alla prima seduta.se questo è il tuo budget io la raccomando.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ergonomischer Stuhl, gutes Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis, toller Support
reviews.reviewText: Ich habe den Stuhl vor knapp 2 Jahren gekauft und seitdem befindet er sich bei mir im Dauereinsatz (Home-Office und privat). Der Stuhl machte von Beginn an einen robusten und wertigen Eindruck und ließ sich mit dem gelieferten Werkzeug und der beiliegenden Anleitung schnell und unkompliziert montieren. Einen unangenehmen Geruch konnte ich damals nicht feststellen. Insgesamt muss ich sagen, dass das Sitzen auch nach mehreren Stunden immer angenehm war. Der Kippmechanismus der Rückenlehne lässt sich individuell einstellen und ermöglicht die nötige Flexibilität beim Sitzen. Insgesamt hatte ich den Eindruck, dass der Stuhl meinem Rücken gutgetan hat.Bis heute klappert und quietscht nichts an dem Stuhl, allerdings gab es dann kurz vor Ablauf der Garantie Probleme mit der Fixierung der Rückenlehne. Nach kurzer Prüfung stellte sich heraus, dass die beiden in der Sitzmechanik verbauten Kunststoffdurchführungen angebrochen waren und die Rückenlehne daher keinen stabilen Halt mehr hatte. Aus meiner Sicht ein klarer Grund für eine Abwertung.Ich habe den Defekt direkt beim Hersteller reklamiert, und schon nach wenigen Stunden erhielt ich Rückmeldung und die Zusicherung, schnellstmöglich ein Ersatzteil (neue Sitzmechanik) zu bekommen. Als dieses dann bei mir eintraf, stellte ich fest, dass die beiden Kunststoffdurchführungen (die Schwachstelle in meinem Stuhl) mittlerweile durch deutlich stärkere Ausführungen ersetzt wurden. Dann aber das nächste Problem: Durch die lange Nutzung waren alle Teile des Stuhls dermaßen verkeilt, dass ich die alte Sitzmechanik nicht von der Gasdruckfeder lösen konnte. Auch hier kam prompt Unterstützung vom Hersteller mit genauen Anleitungen zur Demontage – zwar auf Chinesisch, aber durch Bild und Video gut verständlich. Leider waren meine Versuche weiterhin erfolglos (bzw. hätten den Stuhl völlig zerstört). Letztendlich erklärte sich der Hersteller in meinem Fall dann aber bereit, mir einen neuen Stuhl zuzusenden. Dieser ist inzwischen aufgebaut und wieder im (Dauer-)Einsatz.Fazit:- Das ursprüngliche Modell war bequem und wertig, allerdings mit der angegebenen Schwachstelle, also eigentlich Grund zur Abwertung.- Wenn ich aber den heute erhältlichen Stuhl bewerte, kann ich bestätigen, dass die Schwachstelle inzwischen beseitigt ist. Es bleibt ein komfortabler und rückenschonender Bürostuhl in guter Qualität und mit passendem Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis.- Zuletzt muss ich auch den Support loben, hier habe ich schon ganz andere Dinge erlebt. In meinem Fall wurde immer prompt und freundlich reagiert, die Lösungsvorschläge waren immer nachvollziehbar und verständlich. Man geht auf den Kunden ein und nimmt sich Kritik offenbar zu Herzen (verbesserte Konstruktion).Für das heute erhältliche Produkt daher klare Kaufempfehlung.

Es una excelente opción para aquellos que buscan comodidad y soporte durante largas horas de trabajo o estudio. Con su diseño ergonómico, esta silla está diseñada para adaptarse a la forma natural del cuerpo y promover una postura saludable.Una de las características destacadas de la silla SIHOO M57 es su respaldo ajustable. Esto permite a los usuarios ajustar el ángulo del respaldo para proporcionar el nivel de apoyo necesario para su espalda. Además, el cojín del asiento también es ajustable en altura, lo que permite una mayor personalización y comodidad.Otra característica notable es el soporte lumbar incorporado. Este soporte lumbar brinda un apoyo adicional a la zona baja de la espalda, lo que ayuda a reducir la tensión y la fatiga durante largas horas de trabajo.La silla SIHOO M57 está fabricada con materiales de alta calidad que garantizan durabilidad y resistencia. Además, cuenta con ruedas giratorias que facilitan el movimiento y una base resistente que proporciona estabilidad.En general, la silla ergonómica SIHOO M57 ofrece una combinación de comodidad, soporte y durabilidad. Es una opción recomendada para aquellos que buscan mejorar su postura y reducir la fatiga durante largas horas de trabajo.
